rules: Rule1: Whenever facility1 produces substance1, substance1 is not approved.
Rule2: Whenever disease1 is fatal, disease1 spreads.
Rule3: If organization1 has lax regulations, then in the event of an outbreak of disease1, disease1 is fatal.
Rule4: Either organization1 has lax regulations or facility1 is understaffed.
Rule5: Given that an audit is scheduled for facility1, if facility1 is understaffed, then any outbreak of disease1 will result in disease1 being fatal.
Rule6: If worker1 has skill1, then worker1 is a member of organization1.
Rule7: Whenever worker1 operates equipment1, then if facility1 produces substance1, substance1 is approved.
Rule8: If worker1 is a member of organization1, then worker1 operates equipment1.
Rule9: Whenever substance1 is effective, substance1 treats disease1.
Rule10: Provided that substance1 is safe, substance1 is effective.
Rule11: If it is not the case that substance1 being tested implies substance1 is safe, then substance1 is recalled.
Rule12: If it is not the case that the failure of facility1 being compliant to lead to substance1 being contaminated implies process1 is not approved, then there is an outbreak of disease1.
Rule13: Under the condition that it is not the case that facility1 not being compliant leads to substance1 being contaminated, substance1 is tested.
Rule14: If it is not the case that facility1 not being compliant implies substance1 is contaminated, then process1 is approved.
Rule15: Whenever facility1 is not compliant, facility1 produces substance1.
Rule16: Provided that facility1 is not compliant, substance1 is not contaminated.
facts: Fact1: An audit is scheduled for facility1.
Fact5: Substance1 does not treat disease1.
